stanza.line: No longer mourn for me when I am deaddead
Than you shall hear the surly sullen bellbell
Give warning to the world that I am fledfled
From this vile world with vilest worms to dwelldwell
Nay if you read this line remember notnot
The hand that writ it for I love you soso
That I in your sweet thoughts would be forgotforgot
If thinking on me then should make you woewoe
O if (I say) you look upon this verseverse
When I (perhaps) compounded am with clayclay
Do not so much as my poor name rehearserehearse
But let your love even with my life decaydecay
Lest the wise world should look into your moanmoan
And mock you with me after I am gonegone
